snippet: President Obama is considering leaving American troops in Afghanistan after he leaves office, instead of only a small force to protect the embassy in Kabul, a White House official said.
abstract: Senior National Security Council official Jeff Eggers implies that Obama administration may be considering possibility of leaving troops in Afghanistan after 2016 deadline for withdrawal; comments portend what would be marked shift in administration's stated commitment to leaving only small force based at embassy in Kabul after end of Pres Obama's term.

byline.original: By MATTHEW ROSENBERG and MARK MAZZETTI
byline.contributor: Michael D. Shear and Eric Schmitt contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: President Obama is considering leaving American troops in Afghanistan after he leaves office, instead of only a small force to protect the embassy in Kabul, a White House official said.

headline.main: U.S. May Stay in Afghanistan After '16
